result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark D Erwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Mark D Erwin not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for review hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the state, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of nine months.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Review hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Case is going to resolve with a deferred prosecution agreement but defense needs more time to review with the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defense motion for in-camera inspection heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denied the motion.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/01/15.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
State's Response to defendant's Motion to Compel Disclosure of Medical and Mental Health Records received and filed.  rmm
Defendant's Motion for In-Camera Inspection received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
in Limine from the defense received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant may be filing a motion in limine that should be heard before trial.  Defense to file the motion with the Court by 5/18/15; state to file response by 5/26/15.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Devri E

Defendant Mark D Erwin in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Mark D Erwin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
